node.title: Theo Hayez 'not a risk-taker', inquest hears
node.alt: A man with glasses in a stripe shirt and another man in a dark blue shirt with his arm around his shoulder
node.description: Theo Hayez's family says evidence validates their concerns over the missing backpacker'sÂ "strange" actions.
node.content:
["The family of missing Belgian backpacker Theo Hayez says\u00a0today's testimony from one of his closest friends has validated their belief\u00a0that\u00a0the \"strangeness\"\u00a0of\u00a0Theo's actions on the night he disappeared\u00a0was completely out of character.\u00a0", "The 18-year-old was last seen leaving the Cheeky Monkeys nightclub in Byron Bay around 11pm on May 31, 2019.", "Mobile phone data reveals he searched\u00a0for directions back to his hostel, but then walked in the opposite direction\u00a0taking a dark and secluded bush track towards Tallow Beach.", "The working theory of police is that he tried to climb towards the Cape Byron lighthouse, fell into the ocean, and was swept away.", "Theo's childhood and family friend\u00a0Lou Gymorey gave evidence from Brussels today, describing Theo as responsible and saying excessive alcohol was something he\u00a0feared because he did not\u00a0want to feel out of control.", "", "
Theo Hayez in a seven-second video released by his family.(Supplied: Hayez family)
", "Outside the Byron Bay courthouse, Theo's godfather Jean-Philippe\u00a0Pector said the family\u00a0was reassured to hear Ms Gymorey describe Theo in a way that was consistent with the young man they knew.", "The court has heard consistent evidence from Theo's family and friends that he was not a risk-taker or a heavy drinker, had no interest in drugs, and was an extremely responsible young man.", "Backpackers who were with Theo on the night he disappeared have also given evidence that they did\u00a0not believe he was drunk, despite being kicked out of Cheeky Monkeys because security believed he was \"approaching intoxication\".", "
Significant delay in hostel reporting Theo missing
", "The inquest also heard evidence today from Tom Phillips, the former manager of the Wake Up! hostel where Theo was staying, and Kira Kraut who is the group operations manager of the Millet Group, which runs the hostel.", "Theo was due to check out of the hostel on June 3;\u00a0however, the hostel staff did not examine his luggage until June 6 when they\u00a0found his passport and alerted police.", "", "
Theo Hayez was staying at the Wake Up! hostel in Byron Bay when he disappeared.(ABC North Coast: Emma Rennie)
", "Prior to June 6, the hostel staff had called Theo and left voicemail messages, sent him an email, left notes on his dorm room door, and asked people in the room about where he might be.", "Mr Phillips told the court it was a relatively common occurrence for guests to leave without checking out and for some belongings to be left behind.", "He said the concern set in when they realised Theo had left his passport behind.", "The court heard police asked Mr Phillips to review CCTV footage using a description of Theo; however, it was not until the following day they asked for copies.", "By that time, footage from May 31 had been lost by the system's\u00a0seven-day \"override\", which Mr Phillips admitted was an oversight.", "The inquest heard there had since been industry discussions about introducing a policy of reporting travellers who had not checked out to police within 24 hours.", "
Security guard evidence was 'tough to hear'
", "Mr Pector also spoke outside the court about the reason for Theo's father, Laurent Hayez's emotional reaction during evidence from the Cheeky Monkeys security guard who kicked Theo out of the venue.", "", "
CCTV footage of Theo outside Cheeky Monkeys nightclub and bar.(Supplied)
", "He said it would be hard for people to imagine what it was like to hear that the decision to evict Theo was so subjective.", "\u201cIt\u2019s really tough to hear but we know that it\u2019s probably not linked to what could have happened to Theo afterwards,\" he said.", "\"So that\u2019s where the frustration and the emotion came from.\"", "Mr Pector thanked the crown solicitors, counsel assisting, and legal teams for their \"amazing work\" as well as the witnesses who had given their time to assist the inquiry.", "The second half of the inquest will resume on Monday with evidence from one of the Byron Bay search volunteers and a telecommunications expert."]
